Title: Task title validation - missing client-side check
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create new task
2. Enter title with 300+ characters
3. Click Save
Expected Result: Validation error displayed: 'Title must be 255 characters or less'
Actual Result: Server returns 500 error instead of user-friendly validation message
Workaround: Manually limit title to 255 characters before saving
Root Cause: Missing client-side validation and improper server error handling
Fix Description: Added client-side maxLength validation (255 chars). Updated server to return 400 Bad Request with proper error message instead of 500.
Notes: Fixed in sprint 12. Deployed to UAT on 11/20

Title: Dashboard widget - incorrect overdue count
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Compare 'Overdue Tasks' widget count with actual overdue tasks in database
Expected Result: Widget count matches database query for overdue tasks (due date < today AND status != 'Completed')
Actual Result: Widget shows 23 overdue tasks, but database query returns 19. Difference of 4 tasks.
Workaround: Manually query database for accurate count
Root Cause: SQL query in widget includes completed tasks incorrectly
Fix Description: Fixed WHERE clause in dashboard query: Added AND status != 'Completed' to overdue tasks calculation

Title: Search highlighting - performance issue
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search for common keyword (e.g., 'task')
2. Observe time to display results with highlighting
Expected Result: Results display within 2 seconds with search terms highlighted
Actual Result: Results take 8-12 seconds when highlighting enabled for 1000+ tasks
Root Cause: Highlighting algorithm processes all results client-side, causing performance degradation
Fix Description: Implement server-side highlighting or lazy-load highlighting as user scrolls

Title: Bulk delete - progress indicator missing
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select 50+ tasks
2. Click 'Delete Selected'
3. Confirm deletion
Expected Result: Progress indicator shows deletion status: 'Deleting tasks... X of Y completed'
Actual Result: No progress indicator. User unaware if operation is working for large sets.
Workaround: Delete smaller batches (< 20 tasks) at a time
Root Cause: Progress feedback not implemented for bulk operations
Fix Description: Added progress modal with spinner and count: 'Deleting tasks... 15 of 52'. Operation now async with visual feedback.

Title: Email notifications - SMTP timeout
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Trigger notification (due date reminder)
2. Wait for email delivery
3. Check inbox
Actual Result: Email delayed by 5-10 minutes. Some emails fail with SMTP timeout error.
Workaround: Monitor notifications dashboard for failed sends and resend manually
Root Cause: Azure SMTP relay connection pool exhausted during peak hours
Fix Description: Increased SMTP connection pool size from 10 to 50. Implemented retry logic with exponential backoff. Added dead letter queue for failed messages.

Title: Mobile - date picker overlaps footer
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open app on mobile device (iPhone)
2. Click 'New Task'
3. Tap 'Due Date' field to open date picker
Expected Result: Date picker displays fully visible above keyboard
Actual Result: Bottom portion of date picker hidden behind footer on iPhone Safari
Workaround: Scroll up to see full date picker
Root Cause: CSS z-index conflict between date picker modal and footer
Fix Description: Increased date picker modal z-index to 1050. Added responsive CSS to adjust footer position when modal opens.

Title: Mobile - input fields too small
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Access app on mobile device
2. Try to enter text in 'Description' field
Expected Result: Input fields have minimum height of 44px for touch targets (Apple HIG guideline)
Actual Result: Description field only 32px height, difficult to tap accurately on mobile
Workaround: Use external keyboard or zoom in to select field
Root Cause: Mobile-responsive CSS not following touch target best practices
Fix Description: Increase all input field heights to 44px minimum on mobile viewports. Apply touch-friendly padding (12px). Increase font size to 16px to prevent auto-zoom on iOS.

Title: Screen reader - missing aria-labels
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable screen reader (NVDA/JAWS)
2. Navigate to task list
3. Tab through action buttons
Expected Result: All interactive elements have descriptive aria-labels. Screen reader announces button purposes.
Actual Result: Icon-only buttons (Edit, Delete, Assign) not announced properly. Screen reader says 'button' without context.
Workaround: Use keyboard shortcuts or memorize button positions
Root Cause: Aria-labels not added to icon buttons during initial development
Fix Description: Adding aria-label attributes to all icon buttons: aria-label='Edit task', aria-label='Delete task', etc. Also adding aria-describedby for complex interactions.

Title: Email notification delay - acceptable
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Assign task to user
2. Measure time until email notification received
Expected Result: Email notification sent immediately upon task assignment
Actual Result: Email notification arrives 3-5 minutes after assignment
Root Cause: Email notifications processed in batches every 5 minutes by background job for performance
Fix Description: No fix planned. 5-minute batch processing is by design to reduce email server load and costs. Immediate notification not critical for this use case.
Notes: Closed as 'Won't Fix' - behavior by design. Product owner approved delay as acceptable trade-off.

Title: Task history - timestamp formatting inconsistent
Steps to Reproduce:
1. View task history
2. Observe timestamp formats
Expected Result: All timestamps display in consistent format: 'MMM DD, YYYY h:mm AM/PM' (e.g., Nov 18, 2025 2:30 PM)
Actual Result: Some timestamps show 24-hour format (14:30), others show 12-hour format (2:30 PM). Inconsistent across history entries.
Root Cause: Timestamp formatting not standardized in codebase. Some components use moment.js
Fixed By: Standardized all timestamps using moment.js with format('MMM DD, YYYY h:mm A'). Created shared utility function formatTimestamp() for consistency.

Title: Export Excel - special characters encoding
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create task with special characters in title (é, ñ, ü, 中文)
2. Export to Excel
3. Open exported file
Expected Result: Special characters display correctly in Excel file (UTF-8 encoding)
Actual Result: Special characters show as garbled text (���) in Excel
Workaround: Export as CSV and manually import with UTF-8 encoding
Root Cause: Excel export using ASCII encoding instead of UTF-8
Fix Description: Changed Excel export library to EPPlus with explicit UTF-8 encoding. Added BOM (Byte Order Mark) to ensure Excel recognizes encoding.

Title: Concurrent edit - notification too subtle
Steps to Reproduce:
1. User A and User B open same task
2. User A saves changes
3. User B tries to save
Expected Result: Clear modal warning appears: 'This task was modified by [username] at [time]. Your changes may conflict. Refresh to see latest version?'
Actual Result: Small toast notification in corner, easy to miss. Users may overwrite changes accidentally.
Workaround: Always refresh task before saving to see latest version
Root Cause: Conflict notification using dismissible toast instead of blocking modal
Fix Description: Change conflict notification from toast to blocking modal dialog. Require user acknowledgment before allowing save or discard.

Title: Login - remember me checkbox doesn't persist
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Check 'Remember Me' on login page
2. Login successfully
3. Close browser
4. Reopen browser and navigate to app
Expected Result: User remains logged in. Session persists for 30 days when 'Remember Me' checked.
Actual Result: Session expires when browser closes, even with 'Remember Me' checked. User must login again.
Workaround: Don't close browser or login each time
Root Cause: Remember Me functionality not implemented - checkbox present but not functional
Fix Description: Implemented persistent authentication cookie when Remember Me checked. Cookie expiration set to 30 days. Added secure and httpOnly flags for security.

Title: API - rate limiting not enforced
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make 1000+ API requests in 1 minute
2. Observe responses
Expected Result: After 100 requests per minute, receive 429 Too Many Requests error with Retry-After header
Actual Result: All 1000 requests succeed. No rate limiting applied.
Root Cause: API rate limiting not configured on Azure API Management gateway
Fix Description: Configure API Management policy with rate-limit rule: 100 calls per minute per IP. Add quota limit: 10000 calls per month per subscription.

Title: Search - SQL injection vulnerability (test)
Test Scenario ID:
1. Enter SQL injection payload in search: ' OR '1'='1
2. Submit search
3. Check if unauthorized data exposed
Steps to Reproduce: Search treated as literal string. No SQL injection possible. Results show tasks matching the exact string entry.
Expected Result: Security scan flagged potential SQL injection. Manual testing shows no vulnerability - using parameterized queries.
Workaround: Automated security scanner flagged search input without understanding implementation uses parameterized queries
Root Cause: No fix needed. Confirmed application uses Entity Framework with parameterized queries. Added security test case to regression suite to verify continued protection.
Release Version: Closed as false positive. Parameterized queries in use. Added to security test suite.
